column6: Segment Details - dialogue, movement
column7: Shot Details - when the camera cuts

column2: Goodnight: Telling children to go to bed
column6: Children are laughing, shouting, Margo is jumping on the bed and Edith climbing on the bookcase. Gru says "Come on now, it's bed time" and picks Agnes up, carries her towards beds.
column8: 1. Trying to get the girls into bed

column6: Gru puts Agnes down on the bed as he asks "Did you brush you teeth?", then he gestures and says "Let me smell". Agnes breathes into his face, "You did not!" he exclaims, pointing at her. Edith and Margo are leughing in the background. He then falls backwards as Edith comes flying into him.

Gru lies on the ground with a laughing Edith on his chest, says "Put on your PJ" and "Hold still" as he gets up, lifting Edith by the foot. The girls are laughing, Agnes is jumping ona  bed in the background.

Gru says "Okay, seriously, seriously! This is beddy bye ... time. Right now! I'm not kidding around, I mean it" as he carries Edith to a bed by her foot and sets her down. Margo runs past in the foreground. Gru turns to leave and Edith exclaims "But we're not tired!". Gru answers: "Well, I am tired!" and starts walking away.

column2: Attempted exit: Gru tries to leave, Agnes wants a bedtime story
column6: Agnes sits on a bed, asks "Will you read us a bedtime story?" and pulls out a children's book from under the pillow.
Gru is at the door, he looks at the camera with a raised eyebrow
Agnes holds the book to her chest and looks upwards, cocks her head and blinks (a bell sound accompanies her blink)
Gru says "No", turns and walks out the door as he turns the lights off
Agnes pleads "Pretty please", still in bed holding the book
Gru stands by the door and answers "The physical appearance of the please makes no difference". Edith runs across the room from her bed to the piano.

We see Gru with his hand on the handle, he says: "It is still no, so go to sleep" and once again tries to go out the door. Edith is on top of the piano besides him and says: "But we can't, we're all hyper!" and jumps up and down.

Margo steps down from her bed, grabs Agnes' pillow and holds it while saying: "And, without a bedtime story, we'll just keep getting up and bugging you. All night long". Agnes nods quickly behind her, smiling.
Gru looks, then sighs

column2: Bedtime story: Gru reads to the girls from their picture book
column6: "Ugh, fine", Gru says. He walks into the room, towards the beds and takes the book from Agnes.

Gru sits down on pillows by the beds, saying "Alright, alright". He looks at the book, reads "Sleepy kittens. Sleepy kittens?" and raises his eyebrows. The girls gather around him and turn their attention towards the book.
Shot of the book, with three finger puppets. Gru's finger gestures to them, he asks: "What are these?"
"Puppets, you use them when you tell the story" says Agnes. Gru looks quizzically at the book as he examines it. He then puts his fingers into the puppets and looks at them.
Shot of the finger puppets, they move up and down
Gru raises his eyebrows. "Okay, let's get this over with," he says

Open picture book with three cartoon kittens, pink, green and purple,  on a ball, Gru reads aloud "Three little kittens loved to play, they had fun in the sun all day. The camera pans to the other page with a agrown, pink cartoon cat. Gru continues reading: "Then their mother came out and said, time for kittens to go to bed"
column15: Three little kittens loved to play / they had fun in the sun all day. (as well as) Then their mother came out and said, "Time for kittens to go to bed."

column6: Gru is sitting on the floor with the book in his hand, Edith and Margo on each side and Agnes on his shoulder. He says "Wow, this.. is garbage! You actually like this?" and Agnes answers: "Keep reading!". Gru sighs and Edith says: "Come on!". "Alright, alright, alright, alright"" he says.
Page in book with three kittens (purple pink, green) crying, Gru reading out: "Three little kittens started to bawl".
column15: Three little kittens started to bawl / "Mommy, we're not tired at all."

column6: Gru looking tired with a wide-eyed Agnes on his shoulder, reading "Mommy, we're not tired at all. Their mother smiled and said with a purr."
Picture book with Gru's thumb, depicting an adult pink cartoon cat and a little toy brush, Gru reading "Fine, but at least you should brush your fur".
column15: Their Mother smiled / and said with a purr, / "Fine, but at least / you should brush your fur"

column6: Gru with the book, Edith beside him. "Now you brush the fur," she says, pointing. Gru picks up the little brush from the page and brushes the head of one of the finger puppets. "This is literature?" he says meanwhile. "A two-year-old could have written this", he says, putting the book down and looking at Edith. "Alright," he says, lifting the book.

Slow pan of Gru sitting on the floor with the book, Agnes on his shoulder, Edith on the bed to his rigth and Margo on the floor to his left. "Three little kittens with fur all brushed, said, we can't sleep, we feel too rushed. Their mother replied, with a voice like silk, fine, but at least you should drink your milk".
Gru looking tired, Agnes pointing down and saying "Now make them drink the milk"
Close-up of a page in the picture book, the three kitten finger puppets bend down and touch a drawing of a bowl of milk, one after the other.

Gru on the floor, the girls around him like before. Gru sighs and says: "I dont like this book, this is going on forever". Then he continues reading: "Three little kittens with milk all gone, rubbed their eyes and started to yawn." Agnes yawns, then Edith and Margo, then Gru. Edith puts her head down and Margo takes of her glasses and changes positions so she is lying down. Gru continues reading: "We can't sleep, we can't even try. Then their mother sang a lullaby."

Gru, with Agnes on his shoulder with closed eyes. Edith with closed eyes hanging out of the bed beside him. He turns the page and reads: "Goodnight kittens, close your eyes. Sleep in peace until you rise. Though while you sleep, we are apart, your mommy loves you with all her heart." While reading the last part, he furrows his brow and looks off-screen. He continues to look out/away for a few seconds.
Gru closes the book quickly, saying loudly: "The end! Okay, goodnight!" as he rapidly gets up and walks out. The girls all startle awake and get up on their elbows. "Wait!", Agnes yells after him.
With his hand on the handle of the open door, Gru turns and says: "What?"
Agnes in her bed, askign: "What about goodnight kisses?"
Gru turns away from the girls, halfway behind the door and looks down. "No-no-no" he says, shaking his head softly.
The girls look on as Gru walks out the door, closing it. "There will be no kissing or hugging, or kissing" we can hear him say. The girls all jump slightly as the door closes.
Margo and Edith crawl into bed in silence, Agnes look on.
Margo crawls under her blanket, "He is not gonna kiss us goodnight Agnes", she says and turns off her lamp.
Agnes rubs her eye and says: "I like him. He's nice."
Edith lies in bed, turns off her lamp as she adds: "But scary."
Agnes sits in bed, looks thoughful then says: "Like Santa!"
We see all girls in bed, Agnes lies down and turns off her lamp. The room goes dark.

column2: Gru walks down the hallway, Dr. Nefario engages him in conversation
column6: Gru in the hallway, he looks towards the door but then starts walking, putting his hands behind his back.

A pan of an old, yellowy family tree for Gru's family hanging on the wall - with drawings of Margo, Agnes and Edith added at the bottom. There are other crayon drawinsg on the wall and toys all over the floor.
column15: The Gru Family (and) margo, agnes, edith

column6: Gru smiles and bends down to pick up a toy brush. Dr. Nefario walks in behind him and says: "Only 48 hours to the launch!" He stands at attention and adds, with a swing of his arm: "And all systems are go!". Gru turns around to face him.
column8: 8. Dr. Nefario checks up on Gru's dedication

column6: Gru says "Uuhhhh" and bends down.
column15: The Gru (and when he bends): Family

column6: Gru's hand close to the floor, as he picks up a pink toy mirror and a candy cane. "About that..." he is heard saying.

"I was thinking" says Gru, glancing up at Dr. Nefario as he continues picking up toys, "that maybe we could move the date of the heist." He turns slightly away from Dr. Nefario as he continues pickign up toys. Dr. Nefario steps forward and puts his hands behind his back. "Please tell me this is not as a result of the girls' dance recital. Is it?" he says. Gru backs away, his arms full of toys and says: "No no. No! No! The recital? Don't... that's stupid. I just think it's... kind of weird to do it on a Saturday. I was thinking maybe... hesit is a Tuesday thing, right?". WHiel speaking he moves slowly down the hallway, turning his back to D.r. Nefario
Dr. Nefario says, gesturing with his hands: "Gru! You and I have been working on this for years. It is everything we've dreamed of! Your chance to make history."
Gru furrows his brow, looking down and away, his arms full of toys. "Become the man who stole the moon." Dr. Nefario can be heard saying.
"But these girls are becoming a major distraction!" Dr. Nefario says, gesturing wildly. He puts his arms down and says: "They need to go".
Dr. Nefario takes a step closer to Gru, points his finger at him while saying: "If you don't do somethign about it, then I will."
Gru look sat Nefario, then away. "I understand," he says, turns and walks away.
"Good", says Dr. Nefario with a slight nod.

Two minions ae standing in front of a copier, a bit of a third one sittign atop it is visible. Copies are coming out, the two minions look at each other and giggle, one of them saying "Butt". One of them pick one up, they look at each other and he starts laughing and says: "Butt". The other minion picks up the other copy coming out of the machine, looks at it and starts laughing

The minions continue laughing, as one on the ground hands a copy up to the one sitting on the copier. They laugh loudly, throwing their heads back. In the background, a tiny spaceships starts glowing blue and shaking, suddenly rapidly expanding in size. As it does so, the tip of the space ship spears the copy in the hand of the minion sitting on the copier. The minions stop laughing and look around. Another copy comes out of the maching, one picks it up and he says: "Eh, eh, eh!". He blows a raspberry and turns the copy around, exclaiming: "Butt!". They all resume laughing.

Large windows, the camera pans to show Gru sitting on the floor with the girls, a minion and a stuffed animal. "Right, now, when we put our cups together, we will make the clink sound with our mouths." he is heard and then seen saying. "Ready?" he asks, then turns towards Edith with his arm extended, holding a teacup. "Edith", he says and they touch their cups together, saying "clink". "There we go, now we drink," Gru says, and both he and Edith drink from their cups, slurping loudly. "And Agnes..." he says, turning towards her, extending his arm with the cup. "Clink" they say, touching their cups together. Agnes drinks from the cup as Gru says, "Very good.", raising his arm. The doorbell rings. Gru strats getting up
Gru looks down, saying "Excuse me, girls"
Edith, Agnes, Margo, a minion and a unicorn sitting on the floor, saying "Aawww" in unison."Come on!" Edith adds
Gru walks across the tea party, steps over the minion. "Don't worry, I'll be back. Keep clinking" he says, as he walks out of view
Gru walks down the hallway, the girls can be heard saying "Clink, clink"
Gru opens the door, makes a surprised face and says: "Oh!... Miss Hattie"
Miss Hattie is standing at the door with a frown, Gru continues: "What are you doing here?"
Miss Hattie is standing on the front door step, she says: "I'm here for the girls. I received a call that you wanted to return them"
Gru looks confused
Miss Hattie pulls up a boook, saying: "And also, I did purchase a Spanish dictionary". She quickly raises it towards Gru's face
Gru is slapped across the face with the book and it is psuhed into hsi chest. He holds the book
Miss Hattie says "I didn't like what you said"
Gru starts saying, "But.. I..". Behind him. Dr. Nefario steps out, loudly and repeatedly clearing his throat. Gru turns around
Dr. Nefario puts his hands behind his back and nods
Gru turns around to Miss Hattie, clutching the book, saying "Oh.." He looks back and forth, then at Miss hattie and says: "I will get the girls ready"

Gru walks down the front lawn, holding the girls' suitcases and the plush unicorn. He is walking awkwardly, Agnes holding onto his right leg. Behind him, Margo and Edith are walking slowly. Miss Hattie stands waiting by a car
column10: Gru, Agnes, Edith, Margo, Miss Hattie

column6: Margo pulls Agnes off of Gru's leg, Edith crawls into the car. "Don't let her take us Mr. Gru", Agnes says. M
column10: Agnes, Edith, Margo, Gru, Miss Hattie

column6: Margo pulls Agnes into the car with her. "Tel her you wanna keep us!", Agnes continues.
Miss Hattie says "Come on girls, let's go" and puts he rhand on the car door, about to close it.
Margo caresses Agnes head sitting in the car, she says: "Goodby Mr. Gru, thanks for everything"
Miss Hattie slams the car door, Gru stands looking in the background
Margo rolls up the car window. In the window appears a reflection fo Gru's face, looking away
Miss Hattie gets into the car, turns on engine
column10: Gru, Margo, Agnes, Edith, Miss Hattie

column6: The car slowly starts driving, we see the reflection fo Gru's face in the window
Shot fo Gru throught the backseat window
Shot through the rear car window of of Gru standing on the street as the car drives away
Dr. Nefario is standing on the front door step, as Gru comes into the frame he says: "I did it for your own good"

Gru stands on the front lawn, Dr. Nefario says "Come on! Let's go get that moon!", turns around and walks out of frame. Gru is silent, but looks down the street to where the car went with Miss Hattie and the girls. He looks down, then says: "Right", and starst walkign inside
Gru walks in, closes the door behind him. The camera pans to two minions (one very small) looking out the window, crying and embracing each other.

column2: Seperation and sorrow: Dinner alone, walking hallway, girls in boxes of shame, in bed
column6: Gru sits by a table, resting his head in his had with a solemn expression and looking at a plate of untouched food.
Gru moves the food around on his plate
Gru walks down the hallway with his arms behind his back
We see three minions scrubbing the childrens' drawings on the wall, one of them in a maid costume
Gru looks out of frame  with a faint smile
Drawing of Margo, Edith, Agnes on the wall, a minion starts scrubbing it off
Gru looks sad
Margo looks out from a hole in a cardboard vox
Three cardboard bozes with Margo, Edith, Agnes in one each, looking out through each their small hole
column15: Box og SHAME; Box of SHAME #2; Box of SHAME #3

column6: Gru lies in bed, starts feeling an object hidden under the covers
He sits up and goes to move the covers
The covers are pulled away to reveal some of the girls' toys, including a big doll head
Gru screams, flies up and off the bed
Gru is heard screaming in frustration, a bunch of birds fly up from the roof of the house

column2: Rocket launch preparation - minions prepaing, Gru in spacesuit, handed ticket, entering rocket
column6: A launch room full of minions, can all be heard mumbling
Gate opens and Gru steps in through steam, wearing a pink spacesuit
Gru walks with a determined expression
The camera pans from Grus feet at the end of a platform up to his face where he secures a glass helmet
A minion operates a huge spotlight, turning it
The light is directed at the rocket
The light and camera pan up the rocket
Shot of Gru as a child looking up at the moon, fades into Gru now looking up at the rocket
A regular minion holding the very small minion comes running, panting and stops beside Gru as platform under them starts ascending
The platform ascends with Gru and the minions on it
The regular sized minion says some gibberish and puts a ticket in Gru's hand. Gru looks first at the ticket, then at the minion and says: "What is this for?"
The regular sized minion answers with more gibberish
"The recital? I am the greatest criminal mind iof the century, I don't go to little girls' dance recitals!" he says as he throws the ticket away
The minions reach out to catch the falling ticket, the every small minon in the hand of the regular sized one catches it
The regular size minion regains his balance then steps closer to Gru
The regular minions hand reaches to a pocket in Gru's spacesuit, wherein the very small minion puts the ticket
As the platform reaches the top, the minion turns away while Gru starts walking towards the head of the rocket
Gru walks and swings into the head of the rocket, sits down and starts fastening the seatbelt
He locks the seatbelt
The cockpit seals around Gru with a glass bubble
A minion breathes on the glass bubble and wipes it away with a squeegee
Gru adjusts controls and taps a blender(?) as the screen startd flashing
Dr. Nefario is seen on the screen, "Opening launch bay doors", he says while pressing controls. Then: "Commencing..."
Dr. Nefario is still speaking: "... launch sequence. And we are.."Meanwhile Gru looks up through the glass

column2: Launch: neighbor outside, hector coming, attaching
column6: The roof opens, while Dr. Nefario can be heard over loudspeaker saying "good to go! In t-minus..."
A minion walks at the base of the rocket while platforms can be seen descending while Dr. Nefario can be hear dover loudspeaker saying "10..."
Minions are walking out of the hangar area while D.r Nefarios voice over the loudspeaker says: "seconds"
Steam is coming from the rocket whiel Dr. Nefarios voice says "Ten... nine... eight... seven"
Dr. Nefario adjusting controls, saying "six"
The neighbour is seen polishing the hood of his car, when the polish bottle starts shaking. He looks around as it falls over.
A big shadow of the rocket appears on the street behind him and he turns around
The rocket slowly moves up besides Gru's house, making a lot of noise
The shadow of the rocket covers the neighbour. Hector walsk into the frame
The neighbour turns to look at Hector who raises a futuristic gun
Hector fires the device and a squid shoots out
The squid attaches to the side of the rocket
The giant rocket is taking off from the ground
The rocket flies into the sky
Hector hands the squid gun to the neighbour and is pulled upwards by a rope attached to his pantsuit (and the squid)

column2: In the sky: Gry flies in the rocket
column6: Hector is hauled after the rocket into the sky, yellign "Oh yeah!"
Hector is pulled up by the rope to the squid, grabs the squid and holds onto it and the rocket
Gru sits in the cockpit, he turns to a screen and says "Nice work Doctor, all systems go" - then suddenly Hector appears in front of him
Hector positions himself outside the cockpit with his piranha-shooter directed at Gru and shouts: "Boo yeah!"
Gru looks suprised, then determined as he leans forward
Gru's hand turns a switch on the cockpit in front of Hector - and blue electricity covers his (Hector's) body, makign him jump up

Hector is writhing above with cockpit with blue electricity covering him - and yelling. Then, it disappears and he falls down, bounces off the cockpit and falls further down along the rocket before he falls towards the far-away ground/earth
Hector is seen as a tiny person falling through the sky
Hector wiggles around in the air, making noises. He says: "My flight suit!", stretches his shirt and a web appears between his legs and at his sides
Hector glides through the air, shouting: "Oh yeah! Once again the mighty-" and forcefully hits a metal construction
The metal construction turns out to be a transmission line tower, which shocks Hector and he falls to the ground with a scream
We see the sky through the cockpit, everything is shaking
Gru is in the cockpit, yelling, as the whole construction is shaking

A minion is floating with an Erlenmeyer flask. When he eyes the rocket, he tries to push himself through the air to be in line with its trajectory while speaking gibberish. The rocket hits the minion and flies past
The rocket flies upwards, leaving a big trail of steam/smoke
Another shot of the sky through the cockpit, everything is still shaking
The rocket reaches the end of the atmosphere, where it is dark, and the huge jet fire behind it dies out
Gru's face gets a determined expression and he looks at some controls out of the picture
Big (engine) parts of the rocket detaches and it continues into space
John picks up his phone and looks at the screen for the Caller ID which reads: (withheld) calling. John looks to Sherlock as the phone continues to ring.
column7: 50. The phone continues to ring as Sherlock explains that the muderer would panic knowing that this text could only be from the victim. The phone stops ringing and Sherlock gets up and gets ready to go out. Sherlock says that John should come with him, when John mentions what Donovan mentioned about Sherlock enjoying murder cases. John eventually follows Sherlock.

column6: John looks at Sherlock as Sherlock says: "A few hours after his last victim, and now he receives a text"
Sherlock explains as the phone continues to ring: "that can only be from her. If somebody had just found that phone they'd ignore a text like that, but the murderer."
Sherlock pauses dramatically for a moment until the phone stops ringing. He finishes: "...would panic." He abruptly flips the lid of the suitcase.
Sherlock stands up and walks across the room to pick up his jacket. As John continues to stare down at his phone, Sherlock puts on his jacket and walks toward the door. John finally looks up.
John asks Sherlock: "Have you talked to the police?" Sherlock turns around toward John.
Sherlock answers: "Four people are dead. There isn't time to talk to the police." He adjusts his jacket.
John asks: "So why are you talking to me?" Sherlock reaches behind the door.
Sherlock answers: "Mrs. Hudson took my skull." Sherlock takes his greatcoat from the hook.
John looks toward the fireplace and notices that something is missing from the mantelpiece. He asks: "So I'm basically filling in for your skull?"
Sherlock, putting on his coat, says: "Relax, you're doing fine."
John doesn't move. Sherlock asks: "Well?"
John, apparently a little bummed out, asks: "Well what?"
Sherlock finishes putting on his coat as he says: "Well, you could just sit there and watch telly."
John turns toward Sherlock and asks: "What, you want me to come with you?"
Sherlock is organizing his scarf as he replies: "I like company when I go out, and I think better when I talk aloud. The skull just attracts attention, so"
John smiles briefly.
Sherlock is putting on his scarf when he asks: "Problem?"
John turns around to Sherlock and says: "Yeah, Sergeant Donovan."
Sherlock has finished putting on his scarf when he looks away in exasperation and asks: "What about her?"
John says: "She said You get off on this. You enjoy it."
Sherlock smirks and nonchalantly says: "And I said 'Dangerous,' and here you are." Immediately he turns and walks out of the door.
John sits thoughtfully for a few seconds, then says: "Damn it!" as he roughly leans onto his cane to push himself to his feet and head for the door.
